Key Match Events: Paul George ended his shooting slump and scored 30 points.
De'Aaron Fox scored 35 points and Malik Monk scored 20 points, combining for 55 of Sacramento's 113 points.
Fox hit a lay-up to cut the Sixers lead to four points.
Monk got a pivotal goal contending call to put Sacramento permanently in front.
Tyrese Maxey and Paul George made pivotal mistakes in the fourth quarter, leading to turnovers and points for the Kings.
Post-Match Reflections: Philly's fourth quarter execution left a lot to be desired and must improve for a deep playoff run.
The Sixers have another opportunity tomorrow night against the Golden State Warriors.
Joel Embiid is expected to be available for the next game.
